review_title: Agency cares for those that care for others
pros: Great benefits, positive work environment, opportunities for growth
cons: Hospital setting can be a sad setting to work in

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Dayville, CT
pros:
The clients served and the work you can do with the clients make it worthwhile.
They will pay for trainings.
Generous vacation time
cons: High Caseload, high stress, high exposure to trauma, high turnover

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Tacoma, WA
cons: Nothing bad to say about this company
they dont do raises ever, so almost everyone’s at $14.60/hr. high turnover and little room for upward movement. CEO has no respect for direct care staff

pros: The benefits are good, good co workers
cons: The pay is very low. The hours are not flexible.

pros: Great Company to work for, great benefits, pay and work/home life balance. Room for growth
There are no pros to working here.
cons: Terrible micro managers, unrealistic expectations. Had a manager who tried the “gotcha” move as to why I hadn’t written a note on that day. However that was an approved day off and the reason for no note.

review_title: good starter, but not long term
job_title: Case Manager in Mansfield Center, CT

cons:
This job is amazing to get your feet wet but is in no means long term. Management is corrupt. Pay is embarrassingly low for the work that we do. I regularly work more than 40 hours a week in order to get my work done. Overtime is frowned upon. I made 14.62$ an HR and they would not give me a raise despite exceeding on my evaluations. Employees have not received raises and 9 years. They expect you complete so much paperwork on top of mandatory 80 hours face to face time with our clients. It's impossible ..
The turnover rate is absolutely horrendous and management makes us feel like we are replaceable. Management does not understand that the reason people leave is because of pay. During the covid-19 crisis, their true colors showed up. They did not grant hazard pay. They did not allow employees who COULD work from home, work from home. They provided the reasoning "if everyone can't work from home no one works from home". They furloughed half of case management staff and provided 1 day notice. They did not provide adequetly ppe and cleaning supplies. During the BLM protests they did not once address the issue and support the movement.

No respect from coworkers if you don't have a masters. 

The ceo is an embarassment. At one point during a union meeting, she was banging her fists on the table while employees were negotiating increase of pay saying they have no money to give. 

Their is a reason why their are so many negative reviews... Stay away!!

review_title: Good enough if you're straight out of school
pros: Forthcoming during interview about what the job will be like, no bait-and-switch. HR hires excellent teams in spite of pitiful pay and you'll find yourself surrounded by competent workers who help one another out. Hire undergrad/grads right out of school, so it good if you don't have experience. Health insurance is pretty good. If your position is eliminated, they will work with you to be placed into an empty position. Rare to hear of anyone ever doing 40+ in a week except supervisors.
cons: Pay is abysmal, even for a non-profit: 40k for a clinician is a flippin  joke. Zero chances of growth: they recently hired a new grad to fill a supervisory position after current employees, all with 5+ yrs of experience, interviewed. With new fed/agency changes, it impossible to meet expectations and no help is given from upper management/supervisors to meet said expectations. you will be expected to "make due". So be ready to make peace with not being able to meet what is asked of you (80 hours of client contact a month for Case Management/BHH, Completely booked out days for clinicians with loads of paperwork) and be put on a "plan of correction."

pros: There is a lot of one on one with the clients who appreciate our assistance as staf to help them navigate the social services system and locate community resources.  It is very rewarding to help someone who arrived with nothing, leave for a new life with a firm and positive self image in tow.
cons: Middle management doesn't really have an idea of what we do aside from the descriptions of our jobs as generated by human resources and fail to acknowledge the hard work we put in to keep the program running successfully.  We do not have enough staff to carry the shifts.

pros:
Experience working with individuals with mental illness
Great co-workers
4 weeks vacation
cons:
Senior management is driven by greed and pockets any extra money for themselves.

NO appreciation for employees. Employees are not given any reason to work harder; there are no incentive programs and positive feedback from supervisors is rare. No matter how hard/well you work, it seems the only focus is what mistakes you may have made. I cannot remember the last time I was given any positive feedback from my supervisor despite knowing I perform my job well. 

Employees have not been given any kind of raise in 6 years.

Unmanageable caseloads and paperwork. Unmanageable and unrealistic expectations from management.

Limited advancement opportunities

pros: Excellent benefits, a pleasant working environment.
cons: Stronger internal leadership and structure would improve performance. Rate of pay is lower than average.

review_title: Worked as a Job Coach for various young adults after school.
pros: Great hours, clients generally happy and willing to work.  Makes you feel good that you are doing positive work for the community.
cons: Could be tough sometimes to deal with such a variety of personalities.  The pay was okay but nothing out of the ordinary.

pros: I love my boss and co-workers
cons: The pay is an embarrassment. The building is old and full of mold and is making workers sick and nothing is being done by administration.

pros:
Good working environment
Team work
Chance to promotion
Employees benefits
cons: Same working burden with the employees, doesn't give benefits or favor to relatives.

pros: the schedule offers flexibility no weekends or holidays.
cons: the company offers no raises ever!!!
